snippet: Zephyr Teachout, who is challenging Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo for the Democratic nomination, has satisfied state residency requirements, a State Supreme Court justice said.
abstract: Justice Edgar G Walker of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn rejects attempt by Gov Andrew M Cuomo to block little-known opponent Zephyr Teachout from challenging him in September Democratic Party primary; judge rules Teachout has lived in New York long enough to satisfy residency requirements; Cuomo is expected to win nomination, but is hoping to avoid embarrassment from expected strong showing by Teachout.
lead_paragraph: Zephyr Teachout, who is challenging Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo for the Democratic nomination, has satisfied state residency requirements, a State Supreme Court justice said.

headline.main: A Cuomo Primary Opponent Can Run, a State Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Fails in Bid to Block Fordham Law Professor From Primary Ballot
